title: Artificial Intelligence Applications in Water Treatment and Desalination: A Comprehensive Review
summary: This comprehensive review examines how artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, including machine learning, neural networks, and genetic algorithms, are transforming water treatment and desalination systems. The study analyzes case studies demonstrating that AI-driven systems can reduce energy consumption by up to 50%, improve water quality, and enable predictive maintenance while addressing challenges in integrating AI with renewable energy sources. The research identifies key applications in process optimization, fault detection, and sustainable water management for addressing global water scarcity.
bulletPoints: AI applications in desalination can reduce energy consumption by up to 50% and significantly improve operational efficiency through predictive modeling and process optimization
Machine learning models achieve high accuracy (RÂ² > 0.99) in predicting water quality parameters, coagulant dosage, and contaminant removal, enabling real-time monitoring and automated adjustments
Neural networks and genetic algorithms successfully optimize complex water treatment processes, including chemical dosing, membrane filtration, and distribution network design
Hybrid AI systems combining renewable energy sources (solar, wind) with desalination technologies (RO, MSF) show promise for sustainable water production in arid regions

Predictive maintenance and fault detection algorithms significantly reduce downtime and maintenance costs while improving system reliability, though challenges remain in data availability and model interpretability
